author: Staff Reporter
text:
A total of 120 men attached to Special Force of Railway Protection Force (RPF) had been deployed for escort trains passing through Tirupur railway station, according to railway sources. “The men will also be utilised for track patrols if necessary”, sources added.

The men were attached to seventh battalion of RPF.

The RPF had commenced an inquiry into the pulling of inter-communication chain by some unidentified person who was travelling on Patna-Ernakulam train on Sunday.

The chain was pulled in an unreserved bogie and the train stopped just outside Tirupur station.
title: RPF special team deployed to escort trains
